DataElement.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Children's Version List A Trial 5 Free Recall Z Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the Z score for the Free Recall subtest trial 5 using list A in the California Verbal Learning Test - Children's Version.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test, Children's Version List A Trial 5 Free Recall Z-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Provides a short, individually administered assessment of the strategies and processes involved in learning and recall of verbal material. Assessment is made in the context of an everyday event. It measures both recall and recognition of words over a number of trials and has been found to be sensitive to memory deficits resulting from a variety of neurological conditions. It is designed for ages 5 through 16._The final free recall task from List A of the California Verbal Learning Test for Children._Indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of its distribution's standard deviation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test, Children's Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Provides a short, individually administered assessment
of the strategies and processes involved in learning and recall of
verbal material. Assessment is made in the context of an everyday event.
It measures both recall and recognition of words over a number of trials
and has been found to be sensitive to memory deficits resulting from a
variety of neurological conditions. It is designed for ages 5 through
16.

Concepts.longName: California Verbal Learning Test, Children's Version
Concepts.definition: Provides a short, individually administered assessment of the strategies and processes involved in learning and recall of verbal material. Assessment is made in the context of an everyday event. It measures both recall and recognition of words over a number of trials and has been found to be sensitive to memory deficits resulting from a variety of neurological conditions. It is designed for ages 5 through 16.

Property.preferredName: List A Trial 5 Free Recall Z-Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The final free recall task from List A of the California Verbal Learning Test for Children.:Indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of its distribution's standard deviation.

Concepts.definition: The final free recall task from List A of the California Verbal Learning Test for Children.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. The z-score indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of standard deviation. Calculation of a z-score requires knowledge about the population's standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: CVLT-C:California Verbal Learning Test-Children's Version. Delis, D., Kramar, J., Kaplan, E., and Ober, B., Pearson Assessments: San Antonio, TX. 1994
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for COG study in Rave per request by W.Wong. mc 3/5/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of standard deviation. Calculation of a z-score requires knowledge about the population's standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools
